The Challenge

Traditional Staging Falls Short

Anatomical staging alone misses 27.4% of patients who need different treatment

Limited

Traditional FIGO Staging

Anatomical features only

  • Based solely on tumor extent and spread
  • Misses underlying tumor biology
  • Can dramatically over- or under-estimate risk

Example: Stage IA + p53abn → 16-19% recurrence (not 5%)

Advanced

Molecular Integration

Biology-informed precision medicine

  • Integrates TCGA molecular classification
  • Captures aggressive biology in early-stage disease
  • Identifies treatment de-escalation opportunities

27.4% of patients reclassified with molecular data

Our Approach

How It Works

Four powerful steps to precision risk stratification

STEP 01

Molecular Classification

ProMisE/TCGA hierarchical algorithm classifies into POLEmut, MMRd, NSMP, or p53abn

STEP 02

AI Risk Prediction

XGBoost ML model predicts 5-year recurrence probability with 75% AUC

STEP 03

SHAP Explainability

Transparent feature contribution analysis shows why the prediction was made

STEP 04

Treatment Recommendations

Evidence-based guidelines from PORTEC-3, ESGO, and RAINBO trials

TCGA Classification

Four Molecular Groups

Each with distinct biology, prognosis, and treatment recommendations

POLEmut
~7%

Ultramutated phenotype with robust immune response

Excellent prognosis with >95% 5-year recurrence-free survival

Key Features:

High tumor mutational burden, strong anti-tumor immunity, excellent response to standard therapy

5-year recurrence: <5%
MMRd
~28%

Mismatch repair deficiency, immunotherapy candidate

Intermediate prognosis with 85-90% 5-year recurrence-free survival

Key Features:

Lynch syndrome association, high neoantigen load, responsive to immune checkpoint inhibitors

5-year recurrence: 10-15%
NSMP
~40%

Risk stratified by traditional and emerging biomarkers

Variable prognosis depending on L1CAM and CTNNB1 status

Key Features:

Heterogeneous group, L1CAM positivity indicates higher risk, CTNNB1 mutation associated with late recurrence

5-year recurrence: 10-25%
p53abn
~25%

Aggressive tumor biology with copy-number high phenotype

Poor prognosis with 50-60% 5-year recurrence-free survival

Key Features:

Serous-like molecular features, high genomic instability, requires intensive therapy

5-year recurrence: 40-50%
